p: Although a significant increase in the fungal surface with increasing storage was observed, thyme exhibited a higher inhibition effect, followed by oregano and Satureja. In general, the aromatic plants were significantly more efficient in inhibiting the Penicillium species than Aspergillus. It seems that at 0.5%, the dry aromatic plants encouraged Aspergillus growth since it was observed that the overall mean was significantly higher than that of the control. Contrary, the aromatic plants were effective in inhibiting the growth of Penicillium at the concentrations used.
